name: Aspirin
description: Used to treat pain, fever, and inflammation. It can also be used as a blood thinner.
dosage: Adults: 325-650 mg every 4-6 hours as needed
contraindications: History of asthma, stomach ulcers, bleeding disorders

name: Amoxicillin
description: Used to treat a variety of bacterial infections, including respiratory infections, ear infections, and urinary tract infections.
dosage: Adults: 250-500 mg three times daily for 7-10 days

name: Lisinopril
description: Used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure, and to improve survival after a heart attack.
dosage: Adults: 10-40 mg once daily

name: Metformin
description: Used to control blood sugar levels in people with type 2 diabetes.
dosage: Adults: Starting at 500 mg twice daily, max 2000 mg daily
contraindications: Kidney disease, liver disease, heart failure

name: Atorvastatin
description: Used to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of heart disease.
dosage: Adults: 10-80 mg once daily

name: Levothyroxine
description: Used to treat an underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism).
dosage: Adults: 50-200 mcg once daily
side_effects: Headache, insomnia, tremors when dosage is too high

name: Albuterol
description: Used to prevent and treat wheezing, shortness of breath, and breathing difficulties caused by asthma and COPD.
dosage: Adults: 2 inhalations every 4-6 hours as needed

name: Omeprazole
description: Used to treat heartburn, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), and stomach ulcers.
dosage: Adults: 20-40 mg once daily

name: Sertraline
description: Used to treat depression, anxiety, and obsessive-compulsive disorder.
dosage: Adults: 50-200 mg once daily
contraindications: Use of MAO inhibitors within 14 days

name: Ibuprofen
description: Used to reduce fever and treat pain or inflammation caused by many conditions such as headache, toothache, back pain, arthritis, or minor injury.
dosage: Adults: 200-400 mg every 4-6 hours as needed
contraindications: History of heart problems, stroke, stomach ulcers

name: Cetirizine
description: Used to relieve allergy symptoms such as runny nose, sneezing, itchy or watery eyes, and itching of the nose or throat.
dosage: Adults: 5-10 mg once daily

name: Loratadine
description: Non-drowsy antihistamine that relieves allergy symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose, and itchy, watery eyes.
dosage: Adults: 10 mg once daily

name: Acetaminophen
description: Used to reduce pain and fever. Unlike NSAIDs, it doesn't reduce inflammation.
dosage: Adults: 325-650 mg every 4-6 hours, not exceeding 3000 mg per day
side_effects: Liver damage at high doses, rare allergic reactions

name: Naproxen
description: NSAID used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, and reduce fever.
dosage: Adults: 220-440 mg every 8-12 hours as needed
side_effects: Stomach pain, heartburn, dizziness, stomach bleeding
contraindications: History of heart problems, stroke, stomach ulcers

name: Diphenhydramine
description: Antihistamine that relieves allergy symptoms and also causes drowsiness, useful as a sleep aid.
dosage: Adults: 25-50 mg every 4-6 hours as needed

name: Guaifenesin
description: Expectorant that helps loosen congestion and thin bronchial secretions to make coughs more productive.
dosage: Adults: 200-400 mg every 4 hours, not exceeding 2400 mg per day

name: Dextromethorphan
description: Cough suppressant that blocks the cough reflex in the brain.
dosage: Adults: 10-30 mg every 4-8 hours, not exceeding 120 mg per day

name: Loperamide
description: Anti-diarrheal medication that slows down intestinal movement.
dosage: Adults: 2 mg after loose stool, not exceeding 8 mg per day

name: Simethicone
description: Anti-gas medication that relieves discomfort from excess gas in the stomach and intestines.
dosage: Adults: 40-125 mg after meals and at bedtime as needed

name: Meclizine
description: Antihistamine that reduces symptoms of motion sickness and vertigo.
dosage: Adults: 25-50 mg 1 hour before travel, then every 24 hours as needed

name: Artificial Tears
description: Lubricating eye drops that relieve dry, irritated eyes.
dosage: 1-2 drops in affected eye(s) as needed
side_effects: Temporary blurred vision, mild eye irritation

name: Latanoprost
description: Prostaglandin analog used to treat glaucoma and high eye pressure.
dosage: One drop in affected eye(s) once daily in the evening
side_effects: Eye color changes, eyelash growth, eye irritation

name: Amlodipine
description: Calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure and angina.
dosage: Adults: 2.5-10 mg once daily

name: Losartan
description: Angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB) used to treat high blood pressure and protect kidneys in diabetes.
dosage: Adults: 25-100 mg once daily

name: Glipizide
description: Sulfonylurea that helps control blood sugar levels in type 2 diabetes.
dosage: Adults: 5-40 mg daily
side_effects: Low blood sugar, weight gain, nausea

name: Lantus
description: Long-acting insulin used to control blood sugar in diabetes.
dosage: Individualized dosing based on patient needs
side_effects: Low blood sugar, injection site reactions

name: Tobramycin Eye Drops
description: Antibiotic eye drops used to treat bacterial eye infections.
dosage: 1-2 drops in affected eye(s) every 4 hours

name: Lumigan
description: Prostaglandin analog used to treat glaucoma and ocular hypertension.
dosage: One drop in affected eye(s) once daily in the evening
side_effects: Eyelash growth, eye color changes, eye irritation

name: Valsartan
description: Angiotensin receptor blocker used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
dosage: Adults: 80-320 mg once daily

name: Jardiance
description: SGLT2 inhibitor used to lower blood sugar and reduce cardiovascular risk in type 2 diabetes.
dosage: Adults: 10-25 mg once daily

name: Systane Ultra
description: Lubricating eye drops for moderate to severe dry eyes.
dosage: 1-2 drops in affected eye(s) as needed

name: Metoprolol
description: Beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, angina, and heart failure.
dosage: Adults: 25-100 mg twice daily
contraindications: Severe heart block, severe heart failure

name: Ozempic
description: GLP-1 receptor agonist used for type 2 diabetes and weight management.
dosage: Initial: 0.25 mg once weekly, can increase to 1 mg weekly
contraindications: Personal/family history of medullary thyroid cancer

name: Ketotifen Eye Drops
description: Antihistamine eye drops used to temporarily relieve itchy eyes due to allergies.
dosage: One drop in each affected eye twice daily, every 8-12 hours, no more than twice per day.
side_effects: Eye burning or stinging, blurred vision, dry eyes.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity to any ingredient in the formulation.

name: Olopatadine Eye Drops
description: Antihistamine and mast cell stabilizer eye drops used to treat itching associated with allergic conjunctivitis.
dosage: One drop in each affected eye once daily.
side_effects: Blurred vision, burning or stinging, dry eye, foreign body sensation.
contraindications: Hypersensitivity to olopatadine or any component of the product.

name: Prednisolone Eye Drops
description: Corticosteroid eye drops used to treat inflammation of the eye.
dosage: As directed by a physician, typically 1-2 drops in the affected eye(s) several times a day, with tapering of the dose over time.
side_effects: Increased eye pressure, glaucoma, cataract formation, delayed wound healing.
contraindications: Untreated fungal, viral, or bacterial eye infections.

name: Timolol Eye Drops
description: Beta-blocker eye drops used to treat glaucoma and high pressure inside the eye.
dosage: One drop in each affected eye once or twice daily.
side_effects: Eye stinging or burning, blurred vision, slow heartbeat, fatigue.
contraindications: Asthma, severe COPD, slow heart rate, heart block.

name: Ranitidine
description: H2 receptor antagonist used to reduce stomach acid production, treating conditions like heartburn and ulcers.
dosage: Adults: 75-150 mg twice daily or 300 mg at bedtime.

name: Montelukast
description: Leukotriene receptor antagonist used to prevent asthma symptoms and treat allergic rhinitis.
dosage: Adults: 10 mg once daily in the evening.
contraindications: None well-established, but use with caution in liver disease.

name: Melatonin
description: Hormone that regulates sleep and wakefulness, often used as a supplement for insomnia and jet lag.
dosage: Adults: 1-10 mg at bedtime.
contraindications: Autoimmune disorders, pregnancy and breastfeeding (consult a doctor).

name: Fluticasone Nasal Spray
description: Corticosteroid nasal spray used to treat nasal symptoms such as congestion, sneezing, and runny nose caused by seasonal or year-round allergies.
dosage: Adults: 1-2 sprays in each nostril once daily
side_effects: Nasal irritation, nosebleeds, headache, sore throat
contraindications: Untreated nasal infections, recent nasal surgery or injury

name: Ofloxacin Otic Solution
description: Antibiotic ear drops used to treat ear infections (otitis externa, otitis media) caused by bacteria.
dosage: Adults: 5-10 drops in affected ear(s) twice daily for 7 days
side_effects: Ear discomfort, itching, dizziness, bad taste if it drains into mouth
contraindications: Perforated eardrum (in some cases), hypersensitivity to fluoroquinolones

name: Phenylephrine Nasal Drops
description: Decongestant nasal drops that shrink blood vessels in the nasal passages, reducing nasal congestion and sinus pressure.
dosage: Adults: 1-2 drops in each nostril every 4 hours as needed
side_effects: Temporary burning or stinging, sneezing, increased nasal dryness
contraindications: Severe high blood pressure, heart disease, diabetes, thyroid disorders

name: Penicillin V
description: Antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as strep throat.
dosage: Adults: 250-500 mg every 6-8 hours for 10 days

name: Azithromycin
description: Macrolide antibiotic used for bacterial throat infections in penicillin-allergic patients.
dosage: Adults: 500 mg on day 1, then 250 mg once daily for 4 days

name: Clindamycin
description: Antibiotic used for serious bacterial throat infections, especially in penicillin-allergic patients.
dosage: Adults: 150-300 mg every 6 hours
contraindications: History of colitis, allergy to clindamycin

name: Benzocaine Lozenges
description: Local anesthetic lozenges for temporary relief of sore throat pain.
dosage: Adults: 1 lozenge every 2 hours as needed, do not exceed 10 lozenges per day
side_effects: Numbness, mild irritation, rare allergic reactions

name: Phenol Throat Spray
description: Antiseptic and local anesthetic spray for temporary relief of sore throat pain.
dosage: Adults: 1-2 sprays every 2-3 hours as needed
side_effects: Mild burning, numbness, rare allergic reactions
